segments.text: The kitchen looks ordinary at first, with the woman at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's holding a plate, towel in hand, totally absorbed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink's full and overflowing, water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That puddle on the floor is gross, soaking her shoe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting drenched; what a waste.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are making it worse, climbing for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's on that stool, hand deep in the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the floor's slippery nowâ€”disgusting if they fall into that mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's just standing there, arm up, like it's all fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Sneaking cookies in this chaos; it's so sloppy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a nice garden, but inside it's filthy with water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing this kind of neglect and mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything's going to be ruined if they don't clean it up.
segments.speaker: PAR
